title: Starts with a then any b's
statement:
Over alphabet {a,b}, accept: a, ab, abb, ... and reject: <eps>, b, ba, ...
You may solve using either a REGEX or an explicit DFA transition function.

title: Even number of a's
statement: Over alphabet {a,b}, accept exactly the strings with an even number of 'a' symbols (b can appear anywhere, any number of times).

title: Ends with 01
statement: Over alphabet {0,1}, accept exactly the strings that end with the substring 01.

title: Contains 'aba' somewhere
statement: Over alphabet {a,b}, accept exactly the strings that contain 'aba' as a contiguous substring.

title: No letter c allowed
statement: Over alphabet {a,b,c}, accept exactly the strings that contain no 'c' symbols.

title: Odd length strings
statement: Over alphabet {0,1}, accept exactly the strings of odd length (1,3,5,...)

title: Starts with a and ends with b
statement: Over alphabet {a,b}, accept exactly the strings that start with 'a' and end with 'b'.

title: No consecutive a's
statement: Over alphabet {a,b}, accept exactly the strings that do NOT contain 'aa' as a substring (no two consecutive a's).

title: Contains at least one 1
statement: Over alphabet {0,1}, accept exactly the strings that contain at least one '1'.

title: Exactly (ab)*
statement: Over alphabet {a,b}, accept exactly the strings that are repetitions of 'ab' (including the empty string).

title: No leading zeros (except '0')
statement: Over alphabet {0,1}, accept exactly the binary strings with no leading zeros (except the string '0' itself).

title: Exactly one 'b'
statement: Over alphabet {a,b}, accept exactly the strings that contain exactly one 'b'.

title: Even length AND ends with 'a'
statement: Over alphabet {a,b}, accept exactly the strings of even length that end with 'a'.

title: Count of 1s is multiple of 3
statement: Over alphabet {0,1}, accept exactly the strings where the number of '1' symbols is divisible by 3.

title: Every 'c' must be followed by 'a'
statement: Over alphabet {a,b,c}, accept exactly the strings where every occurrence of 'c' is immediately followed by 'a'.

title: Starts and ends with the same symbol
statement: Over alphabet {a,b}, accept exactly the non-empty strings whose first and last symbol are the same.

title: No substring '000'
statement: Over alphabet {0,1}, accept exactly the strings that do NOT contain '000' as a contiguous substring.

title: Every 'a' must be followed by 'b'
statement: Over alphabet {a,b}, accept exactly the strings where every 'a' is immediately followed by 'b'.

title: Length 3 with middle bit 1
statement: Over alphabet {0,1}, accept exactly the strings of length 3 whose middle symbol is 1.
